Class DashboardController

java.lang.Object
Launcher.DashboardController
public class DashboardController extends Object
Controller coordinating the simulator and the dashboard UI.

This class mediates between the Simulator, the UI-facing model (MapModel), and the visual components such as MapRenderer and VehicleSprite instances. It consumes simulator Events from a blocking queue, updates the Statistics object and the sprite map, and invokes UI callbacks (logging, status and stats updates) on the Swing EDT where appropriate.

  • Constructor Details

    • DashboardController

      public DashboardController(MapModel model, MapRenderer renderer, Consumer<String> logCb, Runnable updateStatsCb, Consumer<String> statusTextCb, Consumer<Color> statusColorCb)
      Create a new DashboardController.
      Parameters:
      model - the shared MapModel containing sprites and node positions
      renderer - the renderer used to request repaints
      logCb - callback to append messages to the dashboard log (called on calling thread)
      updateStatsCb - callback to refresh UI statistics
      statusTextCb - callback to update the status label text
      statusColorCb - callback to update the status label color

  • Method Details

    • getStatistics

      public Statistics getStatistics()
      Return the current Statistics object maintained by the controller.
      Returns:
      the statistics object

    • startSimulation

      public void startSimulation()
      Start the simulator and the background event consumer.

    • stopSimulation

      public void stopSimulation()
      Stop the simulator immediately and clear runtime state.

    • requestGracefulStop

      public void requestGracefulStop()
      Request a graceful shutdown: stop producing new vehicles and wait for currently moving vehicles and pending events to finish.

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shutdown the controller and underlying executor.

      Attempts to stop the running simulator then forcibly shuts down the executor service used for background tasks. After calling this method the controller should not be used again.
